content: She explains, “I’m motivated to walk each year because kidney failure has affected my family and two close friends. I walk for my mother!”These moments of remembrance bring comfort and quiet strength. They remind everyone that even though a person may be gone, the love and lessons they left behind continue with every step forward.Turning Purpose into ActionSome walk to remember. Others walk to educate, advocate, and uplift.Rosalind P., a Patient Care Technician and long-time supporter, views Kidney Walk as an opportunity to speak out. “I do the Kidney Walk to help educate and raise awareness so patients can talk to their doctors about treatment choices.”And for Salman Azam, General Counsel, the event is a mix of mission and togetherness.“My family and I participate in the Kidney Walk every year with DCC’s Team Care. It’s a family event that brings colleagues and loved ones together on a beautiful June day, where we raise awareness and money to build hope for everyone affected.”For many, this walk serves as a way to loudly express what matters: patients’ rights, awareness, and the importance of early action.
title: Leading with Care: DCC & KCC's Kidney Walk Journey
